items.description:
A top-level model which represents an insurance Policy (of various types) or an annuity Contract (fixed
and variable).

id.description:
The policy ID is a globally unique id. This could be a GUID or a composite of system
information and policy number but in the latter case MUST not be used to infer
information about the policy.

policyNumber.description: The recordkeeping system Policy Number; this is NOT globally unique.

transactionId.description:
A transaction, or session key, provided by the source system during a multi-step business
process.  The key is needed by subsequent operations to complete the desired processing.

priorPolicyNumber.description:
Used in situations where there is a one to one correspondence between a current policy
and the one being converted, replaced, exchanged, or reissued.

description.description: Short description of the policy (eg, '2006 Harley Road King').

policyStatus.description:
The current status of the policy in text as decoded from the source system.  Either policyStatus or
policyStatusCode MUST be populated.

policyStatusCode.description:
The current status of the policy as represented by a code from the source system.  Either policyStatus
or policyStatusCode MUST be populated.

transactionStatus.description:
The transaction status is additional information to the policy status, which is an indicator of a possible
change in the policy status due to a pending transaction.  Example:  cancellation in process.  Either
transactionStatus or transactionStatusCode must be specfied.

transactionStatusCode.description:
The transaction status code is additional information to the policy status, which is a code indicating a possible
change in the policy status due to a pending transaction.  Example:  cancellation in process.  Either
transactionStatus or transactionStatusCode must be specfied.

lineOfBusiness.description:
The policy package (ie, policy type). This a 'hint' with respect to the data to found in
#.policyDetail.

locations.description: All of the locations which are associated with this policy or contract.

items.description:
This object represents a geographical location, which contains items to be insured, such as
dwellings and structures, which are fixed to the location, and insured items (vehicles, etc.)
which MAY or MAY NOT be fixed to the location.

id.description:
The sequence or unit number.  This is only valid in the context of
the transaction. Refer to the description property for a
persistent identifier.

addressType.description: Future use.  If used, SHOULD be set to 'Mailing'.

addressAggregate.description: The aggregate address for use when the individual components are not known.

street1.description: First line of the postal address, e.g. 100 Main St.

street2.description: Second line of the postal address, e.g. Apt 100.

state.description: For domestic addresses, use USPS two-digit state code.

countyCode.description:
Properties countyCode and county are mutually exclusive.  Use countyCode when the source
system provides a two-character code.  If the source is the actual County name, then use
the county property.

county.description:
Properties countyCode and county are mutually exclusive.  Use countyCode when the source
system provides a two-character code.  If the source is the actual County name, then use
the county property.

townshipCode.description:
Properties townshipCode and township are mutually exclusive.  Use townshipCode when the source
system provides a two-character code.  If the source is the actual Township name, then use
the township property.

township.description:
Properties townshipCode and township are mutually exclusive.  Use townshipCode when the source
system provides a two-character code.  If the source is the actual Township name, then use
the township property.

acres.description: (Farm) The number of acres at this location

typeFarming.description: (Farm and Pollution) The type of farming done at the cited location.

ownership.description: (Pollution) Indicator whether the location is Owned or Leased

policyDetails.description:
This property contains one or more PolicyDetail-XXX models, each of which contains detail information for
the policy.

There are three PolicyDetail-XXX models:
1.  PolicyDetail-Personal:  This is used for the Auto, Homeowners, and Rural lines.
2.  PolicyDetail-Life:  This is used for the Life and Annuity lines.
3.  PolciyDetail-Commercial:  This is used for Farm and Commercial lines.

insuranceScore.description:
The score or index used to rate the policy, such as a credit score or other indicator of financial
health.

issueAge.description:
The age of the insured or annuitant at the time of issue. This is a policy
level property, meaning that it applies to the entire policy package. This usage is more common
in Annuity contracts.  For a life insurance policy, it is more common to specify the issue age
of the insured at the Coverage
level.

originalInceptionDate.description: The date the policy or contract was first in force.

termEffectiveDate.description: First effective date of the policy (insurance) or contract (annuity) term.

termExpirationDate.description: The date the policy or contract term expires.

maturityDate.description:
(Life/Annuity) The date at which the policy or contract matures--premiums are no longer
being collected.

policyTerm.description: The term of the current policy, in months.

premium.description: The rolled-up value of the premiums of the Insurance Lines

billingDetails.description: details about the billing on this policy.

billingMode.description: The method used to present the bill to the member

paymentMode.description: The Mode of billing/payment, i.e. Monthly, Quarterly or Annually.

policyAssociations.description:
A list of the parties (persons or businesses) which have an association or interest in the policy,
but are not necessarily clients of the enterprise.

items.description:
The PolicyAssociation model is used to model those entities (person or organization) which have an
interest in a Policy, whose data is not necessarily sourced from the client recordkeeping system.

The exact nature of the association is given in the associationType and assoicationSubType properties.

clientId.description: The client id from the the client record keeping system.

locationId.description: If the interest is tied to a specific location, use this to refer to the Location.Id property.

address.description:
Address model--used with various parent objects to describe the US Postal Service
location.

addressType.description: Future use.  If used, SHOULD be set to 'Mailing'.

addressAggregate.description: The aggregate address for use when the individual components are not known.

street1.description: First line of the postal address, e.g. 100 Main St.

street2.description: Second line of the postal address, e.g. Apt 100.

state.description: For domestic addresses, use USPS two-digit state code.

countyCode.description:
Properties countyCode and county are mutually exclusive.  Use countyCode when the source
system provides a two-character code.  If the source is the actual County name, then use
the county property.

township.description:

referenceData.description:
Reference information for this association.  The data in this field could represent a loan number or case
number in the case of assignee (Life) or PolicyInterest (farm).  It could represent the percentage split 
for a Beneficiary (Life).

associationType.description:
Description of the type of association:  (Life) Assignee, Beneficiary; (Farm) Policy Interests, (Multiple) 
Additional Named Insured.  Either #.associationType or #.associationTypeCode must be valued to describe the
relationship of this object with the parent Policy.

associationTypeCode.description:
Descriptive code for the type of association:  (Life) Assignee, Beneficiary; (Farm) Policy Interests, (Multiple) 
Additional Named Insured.  Either #.associationType or #.associationTypeCode must be valued to describe the
relationship of this object with the parent Policy.

associationSubType.description:
Further describes the association to the policy.  In the case of Beneficiary (Life), describes the Beneficiary
type:  Primary or Contingent.

associationRelationship.description:
This field is used to describe the relationship of the Party in this model (PolicyAssociation) to 
the parent Policy model.

demographics.description: Information about the party associated with the policy.

gender.description: The gender of the client, if known.  Either #.gender or #.genderCode is required.

genderCode.description: The system code representing the gender. Either #.gender or #.genderCode is required.

maritalStatusCode.description: The system code representing the marital status.

dateOfBirth.description: The date of birth of the client.

supplementalDocuments.description: Any documents attached to the policy which are required for it's issuance.

items.description: This model containes references to supplemental documentation for a policy.

code.description: The code assigned to the document by the record-keeping system.

items.description: An object which relates two objects via type and id

rootId.description: The id of the source object.

rootType.description: The type of the root object.

rootTypeCode.description: The type code of the root object.

childId.description: The id of the target object

childType.description: The type of the target object.

childTypeCode.description: The type code of the target object.

relationshipType.description: The relationship between the root and target object.

relationshipTypeCode.description: The code for the relationship between the root and target object.
